text:
Erik Duval (11 September 1965 – 12 March 2016) was a Belgian scientist. Duval chaired the informatics section of the computer science department of the Katholieke Universiteit Leuven. He also chaired the research unit on human-computer interaction. His research was situated in the long-standing quest to “augment the human intellect“
Duval died in Antwerp, Belgium from non-Hodgkin lymphoma at the age of 50.
